analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la lhas byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //

translated: and you will attain magical power and more.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te /

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+ya la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When he arrived, he said to the venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya,

analyzed: gnas brtan gyis bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan du gsol /
translated: “Elder, please teach me the path to magical power.”🔽The venerable Ājñātakauṇḍinya looked into the Blessed One’s mind,

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+yas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs la yang rnam par bltas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun shes ko'u di n+yas bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs la yang rnam par bltas /
translated: and then he said to Devadatta,🔽“Devadatta, the Blessed One has not given his permission for me to teach you the path to magical power.”

original: lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de byung bar yang rig nas lhas byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de byung bar yang rig nas lhas byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Knowing that such a sinful desire had arisen in Devadatta, he said to him:

original: lhas byin khyod kyis gzugs tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin khyod kyis gzugs tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Devadatta, you should properly attend to form, and then you will have supernormal powers and other abilities.

original: lhas byin khyod kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin khyod kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Devadatta, you should properly attend to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and then you will have supernormal powers and other abilities.”

original: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Devadatta thought,

analyzed: gnas brtan kun shes ko'u di n+ya yang bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston par mi byed do snyam du rig nas tshe dang ldan pa rta thul dang / bzang po dang / rlangs pa dang / ming chen dang / grags pa dang / gang po dang /
translated: “The elder Ājñātakauṇḍinya does not teach me the path to supernormal powers.” Knowing this, he went to the venerable Aśvakī, Bhadrika, Vāṣpa, Mahānāman, Śāriputra, and Maudgalyāyana,

original: dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzang la sogs pa gnas brtan lnga brgya po dag ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzang la sogs pa gnas brtan lnga brgya po dag ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: He went to the five hundred elders, such as Vimuktasena,🔽Vimuktisena,🔽and Subahu.

original: gnas brtan lnga brgya po dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: gnas brtan lnga brgya po dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He went to the five hundred elders, such as Vimala, Gavāṃpati, Subāhu, and so on, and said:

original: gnas brtan dag gis bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan du gsol /
analyzed: gnas brtan dag gis bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan du gsol /
translated: “Elders, please teach me the path of miracles.”

original: de nas gnas brtan lnga brgya po bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyi thugs yid la rnam par bltas /
analyzed: de nas gnas brtan lnga brgya po bdag gis bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyi thugs yid la rnam par bltas /
translated: Then the five hundred elders looked into the minds of the Blessed One and the elder monks,

original: lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de byung bar yang rig @407a *//
analyzed: lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de byung bar yang rig @407a *//
translated: and they knew that Devadatta had such a sinful desire.

original: nas lhas byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: nas lhas byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: They said to Devadatta:

original: lhas byin khyod kyis gzugs tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin khyod kyis gzugs tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Devadatta, you should properly contemplate form, and then miracles and other things will happen to you.”

original: lhas byin khyod kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin khyod kyis tshor ba dang 'du shes dang 'du byed rnams dang rnam par shes pa tshul bzhin yid la gyis shig dang khyod la rdzu 'phrul dang gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Devadatta, you should properly attend to feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, and then you will attain supernormal powers and other abilities.”

original: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Devadatta thought,

analyzed: gnas brtan lnga brgya po dag kyang bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam mi ston te /
translated: “The five hundred elders do not teach me the path of supernormal powers.

original: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag gis sngar bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par bgros par gyur pas des na 'ga' yang bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston par mi byed na /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe dang ldan pa 'di dag gis sngar bcom ldan 'das dang lhan cig yang dag par bgros par gyur pas des na 'ga' yang bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston par mi byed na /
translated: Since these venerable ones have already discussed this with the Blessed One, none of them will teach me the path of supernormal powers.

original: bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston par nus pa gzhan su yod snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam ston par nus pa gzhan su yod snyam mo //
translated: Who else is able to teach me the path of supernormal powers?”

translated: At that time, the venerable Daśabala Kāśyapa was staying in the cave of Gṛdhrakūṭa in Rājagṛha.🔽Then Devadatta thought,

original: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Devadatta thought,

original: gnas brtan 'od srung stobs bcu pa 'di ni yun ring po nas g-yo med pa sgyu med pa drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can bdag gi phu nu bo rgan pa kun dga' bo'i mkhan po yin pas gnas brtan 'od srung stobs bcu pas bdag la rdzu 'phrul
analyzed: gnas brtan 'od srung stobs bcu pa 'di ni yun ring po nas g-yo med pa sgyu med pa drang po drang po'i rang bzhin can bdag gi phu nu bo rgan pa kun dga' bo'i mkhan po yin pas gnas brtan 'od srung stobs bcu pas bdag la rdzu 'phrul
translated: “This elder Daśabala Kāśyapa has been honest, without deceit, and of a straightforward nature for a long time. He is the preceptor of my elder brother, Ānanda. The elder Daśabala Kāśyapa is able to teach me the path of miraculous powers.”

analyzed: gyi lam ston par nus so snyam du rig nas / tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung stobs bcu pa ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Knowing this,🔽he went to the venerable Daśabala Kāśyapa and,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung stobs bcu pa'i rkang pa gnyis la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te mtha' gcig tu 'dug go /

translated: Having sat to one side, Devadatta said this to the venerable Daśabala Kāśyapa:

translated: “Elder, please teach me the path of miraculous powers.”

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung stobs bcu pas /
translated: Then the venerable Daśabala Kāśyapa

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang dge slong gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyi thugs yid dang / lhas byin la sdig pa can gyi 'dod pa'i rnam pa de lta bu de byung ba la rnam par ma bltas par lhas byin la rdzu 'phrul gyi lam bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One and the elder monks did not consider the fact that Devadatta had such a sinful desire, and they taught him the path of magical powers.

translated: Then Devadatta, practicing diligently in the first and last watches of the night, attained the magical powers of the worldly path based on the first concentration.🔽He became one and then many.

original: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: He became many and then one.

translated: He experienced being visible and invisible through knowledge and seeing.

translated: He went through walls, through ramparts, through mountains, with his body unimpeded.

translated: For example, like a bird in the water.

translated: And in the water, he walks without sinking, going upstream.

translated: For example, like a bird in the sky.

translated: He emits smoke and flames.

analyzed: dper na me'i phung po chen po bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a great mass of fire.

analyzed: lus las chu'i rgyun 'byin te /
translated: From his body, he emits a stream of water.

analyzed: dper na sprin chen po bzhin no // nyi ma dang zla 'di gnyis 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di ltar mthu @408a *//
translated: For example, like a great cloud.

analyzed: che ba 'di ltar gzi brjid che ba la yang lag pas nom zhing nyug par byed do //
translated: He touches and strokes with his hand even these two, the moon and sun, so mighty and powerful.

original: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lhas byin 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then Devadatta thought this:🔽“I too should perform miracles in the city of Rājagṛha.”

analyzed: bdag la gang gi ming gis 'dzam bu'i gling zhes bya bar shes pa'i shing 'dzam bu de las 'dzam bu'i 'bras bu lhags pa kha dog dang dri dang ro dang ldan pa rnams dang / de'i nye 'khor nas skyu ru ra'i tshal dang / bil ba'i tshal dang /
translated: The tree called Jambu from which the fruit of the rose-apple tree is known as the Rose-Apple Continent, and the fruit of the rose-apple tree that has fallen, endowed with color, smell, and taste, and from the groves of sour plums and bilva trees in its vicinity, and the fruit of those that have fallen, endowed with color, smell, and taste, fill your alms-bowl and carry it away.

translated: Having done so, you should enjoy it yourself.🔽 If there is a remainder, you should share it with the monks.

analyzed: lhag ma yod na dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya ba dang / shar gyi lus 'phags dang / nub kyi ba lang spyod du yang song /
translated: You should also go to Videha in the east, Godaniya in the west, and Kuru in the north.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan du yang song ste /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan du yang song ste /
translated: You should also go to the northern continent of Kuru.

original: ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu'i 'bru dag gis lhung bzed bkang ste khyer nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyad par bya /
analyzed: ma rmos ma btab pa'i 'bras s'a lu'i 'bru dag gis lhung bzed bkang ste khyer nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyad par bya /
translated: He should fill his alms bowl with unplanted, uncultivated rice and take it away.🔽He should enjoy it himself and share it with the monks.

analyzed: lhag ma yod na dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya ba dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyis lha rnams kyi nang du yang song /
translated: He should go to the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings,

analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du yang song ste /
translated: and to the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: lha'i bdud rtsi dag gis lhung bzed bkang ste khyer nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyad par bya /
analyzed: lha'i bdud rtsi dag gis lhung bzed bkang ste khyer nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyad par bya /
translated: He should fill his alms bowl with the nectar of the gods and take it away.

original: lhag ma yod na dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya ba dang / yul gang dag 'byor pa rgyas pa /
analyzed: lhag ma yod na dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya ba dang / yul gang dag 'byor pa rgyas pa /
translated: He should enjoy it himself and share it with the monks.

original: bde ba lo legs pa /
analyzed: bde ba lo legs pa /
translated: He should go to any country that is prosperous, flourishing, peaceful, and well-populated.

original: skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba de dag nas bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang ba bsod pa dag gis lhung bzed @408b bkang ste khyer nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod par bya /
analyzed: skye bo dang mi mang pos gang ba de dag nas bca' ba dang bza' ba gtsang ba bsod pa dag gis lhung bzed @408b bkang ste khyer nas bdag nyid kyang yongs su longs spyod par bya /
translated: He should fill his alms bowl with pure, wholesome food from those crowded with people and carry it away. He should enjoy it himself.

original: lhag ma yod na dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya bas ci zhig byas /
analyzed: lhag ma yod na dge slong dag la yang bgo bsha' bya bas ci zhig byas /
translated: If there is any left over, he should share it with the monks. What would he do with it?

original: bdag gis ma ga dha'i zhing 'di na mi gtso bo gang yin pa rjes su 'jug par bya na /
analyzed: bdag gis ma ga dha'i zhing 'di na mi gtso bo gang yin pa rjes su 'jug par bya na /
translated: “I will follow the most important person in this Magadha region.

original: ma ga dha'i zhing 'di na gang rjes su 'jug par byas nas tshegs chung dus skye bo phal po che'i tshogs kyang rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'i mi'i gtso bo rjes su 'jug par bya ba gang yod snyam mo //
